project.teaser: INCITE-DEM's experienced Consortium aims to enhance inclusive participation and civic engagement while expanding democratic innovation and dynamic feedback mechanisms between citizens and institutional actors in representative democracies. Currently, “wicked problems”...
project.objective: INCITE-DEM's experienced Consortium aims to enhance inclusive participation and civic engagement while expanding democratic innovation and dynamic feedback mechanisms between citizens and institutional actors in representative democracies. Currently, “wicked problems” relating to ecological crises but also media developments and digital divides create unprecedented pressures on democracies. Next to related socio-economic challenges, we’re witnessing a decline in political trust and the formation of new societal cleavages. INCITE-DEM will offer a unique contribution to the future of democracy in Europe by harnessing historical and quantitative and qualitative social science research, agent-based modelling, design thinking, and advanced analytical methods for the purpose of expanding inclusive participation and engagement and fuelling democratic innovation. Furthermore, we will implement Democracy Labs (DLabs) in six countries, where citizens, representatives of democratic innovation initiatives, policymakers, and other stakeholders come together to co-create imaginaries of inclusive democratic innovations. The new solutions and democratic futures envisioned are the objects of design fiction products. All innovations co-created in the DLabs are then validated through a choice experiment survey with citizens and interactive fora with policymakers, to check their feasibility and the potential for implementation. Lastly, a set of policy roadmaps for a sustainable, inclusive, and innovative democracy in a world facing deep societal, technological and ecological transformations are produced and presented to a broad range of stakeholders at multiple levels of governance in Europe.
project.title: INCITE-DEM – Inclusive Citizenship in a world in Transformation: Co-Designing for Democracy
project.keywords: inclusivity, digitalisation, sustainability, historical review, democratic innovations, case studies, democracy labs, design fiction, choice experiment, interactive fora, policy pathways

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - INCITE-DEM (INCITE-DEM – Inclusive Citizenship in a world in Transformation: Co-Designing for Democracy)
result.teaser: INCITE-DEM’s main goal is to enhance inclusive participation and civic engagement, through expanding democratic innovation and dynamic feedback mechanisms between citizens and institutional actors in representative democracies. The activities involve a multidisciplinary and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: D8.3 Data Management Plan
result.description: The deliverable presents the DMP to ensure all data is FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable). It will establish a series of criteria that make data findable by other users and signal which data will be accessible or kept confidential due to ethical requirements.

result.title: D1.1 Report and timeline of (e-) participation and engagement practices
result.description: The deliverable presents a report on the history of participation and engagement with a particular focus on the role of sustainability-oriented practices in this field of practice in Europe since WWII. The deliverable is successful if it includes a characterisation of participation and engagement, at different scales (from local to global), since WWII, with a focus on sustainability and environmental civic engagement.

result.title: D3.1: Dialogue Tool based on the HUMAT framework, with instructions (written and video)
result.description: The deliverable describes how to set up a dialogue session including (1) intake sessions with explanation, (2) scenario production and presentation, and (3) reflective dialogue structuring and moderation principles. The material, including the Dialogue Tool itself, will be available online (i.e., on the NetLogo platform and GitHub repository). The deliverable is successful if it presents a prototype of the dialogue tool, plus supporting materials (e.g., recorded explanations).

result.title: D7.1 Project Website and Logo
result.description: "The project's website (using an ""eu.domain"") will be the primary channel for all project communications. It equally works as an open knowledge repository and is one of the main gateways to all other communication channels (e.g., social media channels, data repositories). A project logo will be provided. The website will be updated throughout the project as needed, including with contents to support INCITE-DEM's Community of Practice."

result.title: D2.1 Report on perceptions and attitudes toward democracy
result.description: Drawing on analysis of European survey data (e.g. European Social Survey) and other cross-country surveys, the report details trends in citizens’ attitudes towards participation and engagement, political trust, and satisfaction with democracy. The deliverable is successful if it presents the results of statistical analyses showing trends in citizens' attitudes.

result.title: D1.3 Criteria and indicators for inclusive participation and engagement
result.description: This report will systematise a set of criteria and indicators for inclusive participation and engagement for a socio-ecological transformation. The deliverable is successful if it presents the criteria and indicators in a systematic and clear way to support future research.

result.title: D1.2 Database and timeline on the history of participation and engagement
result.description: The deliverable presents a timeline and database of sustainability-related, innovative, and inclusive participation and engagement practices in Europe since the early days of digitalisation. The deliverable is successful if it includes a database, including specific examples and characteristics of inclusive participation and engagement practices.

result.title: D4.1 Generative Design Toolkit for the DLabs
result.description: This deliverable presents the results from Task 4.1 and 4.2 and offers a set of insights for recruiting, setting up, and facilitating generative design research and co-creation in the context of democracy lab approaches. The deliverable is successful if it offers an effective methodological guide for democracy lab approaches.

result.title: D6.1 Policy Brief
result.description: Synthesis of key policy insights from the first 14 months of the project (2 to 5 pages)

result.title: D7.2 Plan for the Dissemination and Exploitation of Results
result.description: The Plan for the Dissemination and Exploitation of Results (first version) offers a detailed plan for the project's dissemination, communication, and exploitation activities, to achieve the expected impacts and dissemination targets of the project.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
